intro: Guarea excelsa subsp. dubia, commonly known as the yellow-wood tree, is a member of the family Meliaceae, characterized by its tropical origin and distinctive botanical features. It is a large evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 40 meters, with a straight trunk and a broad, spreading crown. The leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, often with a slightly waxy texture. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and arranged in panicles, typically blooming in clusters. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in tropical ecosystems.
